We have the following important properties
\mathbb {P}(A_{\epsilon }^{(n)})\geq 1-\epsilon {\text { for large enough }}n
|A_{c}^{(n)}|\leq 2^{n(H(X)+\epsilon )}
|A_{\epsilon }^{(n)}|\geq (1-\epsilon )2^{n(H(X)-\epsilon )}\;\text {for large enough }\;n\;, Together, this says that, depending on the entropy, the typical set can contain most of the probability despite being much smaller than the entire space.
